intro: Calculate your bonus tax in Ireland with our comprehensive calculator. Bonuses are a significant part of many Irish salaries, but understanding how they're taxed is crucial for accurate financial planning. Unlike regular salary, bonuses are taxed at your marginal PAYE rate, potentially pushing you into higher tax brackets. This calculator uses official 2026 Revenue.ie rates to show you exactly how much tax you'll pay on bonuses, including PAYE income tax, Universal Social Charge (USC), and Pay Related Social Insurance (PRSI) contributions. Whether you're expecting a year-end bonus, performance bonus, or other supplemental pay, this tool helps you understand your true take-home bonus amount and overall compensation package.
howThisCalculatorWorks: This Ireland bonus tax calculator determines your take-home bonus by adding the bonus to your annual salary, then calculating Irish taxes on the total amount. Bonuses are taxed at marginal rates - if your base salary puts you in the 20% bracket but the bonus pushes you into the 40% bracket, the entire bonus is taxed at 40%. The calculator shows both the bonus tax breakdown and your total salary including bonus, helping you understand the overall tax impact. Irish bonuses are typically paid as a lump sum and taxed under the PAYE system with USC and PRSI calculated on total earnings. Some employers offer salary sacrifice schemes for bonuses, which may offer tax advantages.

bonusTaxationRules.title: Irish Bonus Taxation Rules
rules: **Marginal Rate Taxation:** Bonuses are taxed at your marginal PAYE rate, not averaged
**Total Earnings:** Bonuses are added to your annual salary for tax calculations
**Lump Sum:** Bonuses are typically paid as one-off payments, not spread over the year
**USC Impact:** Higher total income may push bonuses into higher USC brackets
**PRSI Impact:** Bonuses increase total earnings, affecting social insurance
**Salary Sacrifice:** Some employers offer tax-advantaged bonus schemes

faqs.question: How are bonuses taxed in Ireland?
faqs.answer: Bonuses are added to your annual salary and taxed at your marginal PAYE rate. If your regular salary puts you in the 20% bracket but the bonus pushes you into the 40% bracket, the entire bonus is taxed at 40%. USC and PRSI are calculated on total earnings.

faqs.question: Are bonuses taxed differently from salary?
faqs.answer: No, bonuses are taxed the same as regular salary under PAYE, but at marginal rates rather than being averaged across the year. This can result in bonuses being taxed at higher rates than your standard salary.

faqs.question: Can I reduce bonus tax through salary sacrifice?
faqs.answer: Some Irish employers offer salary sacrifice schemes where you can sacrifice part of your bonus for benefits like pensions or health insurance, which may reduce your taxable income. Check with your employer for available schemes.

faqs.question: When are bonuses usually paid in Ireland?
faqs.answer: Bonuses in Ireland are typically paid annually, often at year-end (December/January) or following the company's financial year-end. Some companies pay quarterly or half-yearly bonuses.

faqs.question: Do bonuses affect my tax credits?
faqs.answer: Yes, bonuses increase your total income, which may affect your tax credits and rate band. Higher income may reduce or eliminate certain tax credits you're entitled to.
